item.title: Susan add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You don't stop laughing when you grow old, you grow old when you stop laughing." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Susan add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Susan add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Susan add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Those who dance are considered insane by those who cannot hear the music." -- George Carlin

item.title: Susan add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If I were not a physicist, I would probably be a musician. I often think in music. I live my daydreams in music. I see my life in terms of music." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Susan add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If I can't dance to it, it's not my revolution." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Susan add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Without music to decorate it, time is just a bunch of boring production deadlines or dates by which bills must be paid." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Susan add a quote by Oliver James
item.description: "Music is my higher power" -- Oliver James

item.title: Susan add a quote by Quentin R. Bufogle
item.description: "I want an avowed atheist in the White House. When time comes to push that button, I want whoever's making the decision to understand that once it's pushed, it's over. Finito. They're not gonna have lunch with Jesus. Won't be deflowering 72 virgins on the great shag carpet of eternity, or reincarnated as a cow. I want someone making that decision who believes life on this Earth isn't just a dress rehearsal for something better -- but the only shot we get." -- Quentin R. Bufogle

item.title: Susan add a quote by Susan Fleet
item.description: "The only difference between a rut and a grave is depth." -- Susan Fleet
